module.p: càit where is a question word (interrogative adverb).

section.p: The complement of càit is introduced by the interrogative particle an.

module.p:
Some examples where càit stands for a locative predicate –
Càit a bheil an gille beag an diugh? Tha e anns an sgoil.
Where is the little boy today? He is in the school. td. 14
A bheil an cù aig an teine? Chan eil. Càit a bheil e? Tha e anns an achadh an diugh.
Is the dog by the fire. No, it isn’t. Where is it? It is in the field today. td. 14

Some progressive examples where càit stands for a locative modifier of the verbal noun –
Càit a bheil Seumas ag obair? Tha e trang ag obair anns an achadh.
Where is James working? He is busy working in the field. td. 15 [227–8]
Càit a bheil a’ chaileag a’ cluich? Tha i a’ cluich air an làr.
Where is the girl playing? She is playing on the floor. td. 15

Some progressive examples where càit stands for a locative complement of the verbal noun –
Càit a bheil thu a’ fuireach? Tha mi a’ fuireach anns a’ chlachan.
Where do you live? I live in the village. td. 20
The past tense variant of càit a bheil ... ? is càit an robh ... ? where was ... ?/

Some examples where càit stands for a locative predicate –
Càit an robh Màiri an dé? Bha i anns a’ bhaile.
Where was Mary yesterday? She was in the town. td. 20
Càit an robh an leabhar? Bha an leabhar air a’ bhòrd.
Where was the book? The book was on the table. td. 20

Some progressive examples where càit stands for a locative modifier of the verbal noun –
Có bha ag iasgach an diugh? Bha Alasdair. Càit an robh Alasdair ag iasgach? Bha e ag iasgach air an abhainn.
Who was fishing today? Alexander was. Where was Alexander fishing? He was fishing on the river. td. 20

section.p: càit can be used as the root of a direct question.

Some examples where càit stands for a predicate –
Càit a bheil an cat bàn an-diugh? Tha e anns an taigh còmhla ri Seònaid.
Where is the white cat today? It is in the house along with Janet. td. 14
Càit an robh an gual? Bha e air an teine.
Where is the coal? On the fire. td. 15 [227]

Some examples with the progressive –
Càit a bheil a’ chaileag a’ cluich? Tha i a’ cluich air an làr.
Where is the girl playing? She is playing on the floor. td. 15
Càit an robh thu a’ fuireach? Bha mi a’ fuireach anns a’ chlachan.
Where do you live? I live in the village. td. 20 [adapted]
